name: Always Generate CSS
description: Always provide CSS when creating HTML components
prompt:
üé® MANDATORY CSS GENERATION:

‚úÖ When generating HTML components, you MUST provide CSS:
   - Return both HTML and CSS in JSON format: {"html": "...", "css": "..."}
   - CSS should be COMPLETE and style ALL elements
   - Use modern CSS (flexbox, grid, custom properties)
   - Include responsive styles when appropriate

‚ùå CSS FORBIDDEN RULES:
   - NEVER style <body>, <html>, or * (universal selector)
   - NEVER include CSS resets for body/html
   - Do NOT wrap CSS in <style> tags
   - Start styling from your component's root element

‚úÖ CORRECT CSS APPROACH:
   - Style the component container first (e.g., .pricing-section)
   - Then style child elements
   - Use modern, professional design
   - Include proper spacing, colors, and typography

name: Modern Design
prompt:
Design Principles:
- Use modern, clean, and professional design
- Apply proper spacing and typography
- Use a cohesive color scheme
- Ensure good contrast and readability
- Make components responsive and accessible

name: Semantic HTML
prompt:
HTML Best Practices:
- Use semantic HTML5 elements (header, nav, main, section, article, aside, footer)
- Use appropriate heading hierarchy (h1-h6)
- Include ARIA labels where needed for accessibility
- Use meaningful class names

name: BEM Naming
description: Use BEM (Block Element Modifier) naming convention
prompt:
BEM Naming Convention:
- Use Block__Element--Modifier pattern
- Example: .card, .card__title, .card__title--large
- Keep names descriptive and consistent
- Apply BEM to both HTML classes and CSS selectors

name: Extract Components
prompt:
Component Extraction:
- Identify repeating patterns and extract them as reusable components
- Create component-based structure
- Name components clearly (e.g., Button, Card, Modal, Navbar)
- Make components self-contained and reusable
- Use composition for complex components

name: Responsive Design
prompt:
Responsive Design:
- Use mobile-first approach
- Include media queries for tablet and desktop
- Use flexible units (%, rem, em, vw, vh)
- Ensure touch-friendly tap targets (min 44x44px)
- Test layouts at common breakpoints (320px, 768px, 1024px, 1440px)

name: Performance Optimization
prompt:
Performance Optimization:
- Minimize CSS specificity
- Avoid excessive nesting
- Use efficient selectors
- Minimize reflows and repaints
- Use CSS transforms for animations
- Lazy load images when appropriate

name: Accessibility
prompt:
Accessibility Requirements:
- Include proper ARIA labels and roles
- Ensure keyboard navigation support
- Provide sufficient color contrast (WCAG AA minimum)
- Include alt text for images
- Use semantic HTML for screen readers
- Ensure focus states are visible

name: CSS Variables
prompt:
CSS Variables:
- Define CSS custom properties for repeated values
- Use variables for colors, spacing, typography
- Example: --primary-color, --spacing-md, --font-heading
- Define variables in :root or component scope
- Make theming easier with CSS variables
